list_definition.definition: the line formed by the sewing together of two pieces of cloth etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This jacket is coming apart at the seams.

list_definition.definition: the line where two things meet or join

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Water was coming in through the seams of the boat.

list_definition.definition: a thin line or layer of coal etc in the earth

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve pinned the skirt together but I haven’t seamed it yet.

list_ex_of_english: A colliery is unable to develop expanding seams.
Clastic layers up to 10 cm thick are common within thick seams.
There has been the problem of obtaining ever-increasing revenue from the rating system, which has been creaking at the seams.
The system was tested on two types of seams.
They are now bursting at their seams and young boys and girls are queuing up to get in.
There is a desperate shortage of affordable housing, and that is causing some of our public services to crack at the seams.
I know there are five other seams under that.
As the scene changes, the seams show, and such discontinuities, unmitigated by costume or staging, ultimately reveal the opera's ' setting' to be an imagined world.
